intro: Blakea echinata, commonly known as the spiny blakea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Blakea echinata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
